title: Legal Trouble for Efforts to Fight Climate Change
itunes:title: Legal Trouble for Efforts to Fight Climate Change
description:
Pat Parenteau, a professor at the University of Vermont Law School, discusses how the Supreme Court's decisions undercutting the so-called administrative state signal trouble ahead for the EPA's efforts to address climate change.

Jennifer Rie, Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Litigation Analyst, discusses why antitrust enforcer's efforts to toughen merger reviews, could be problematic for Microsoft's Activision deal.

June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
